page.title: 06THE HISTORY OF STOCKTON
page.content: APLEY ESTATES,INCLUDING APLEY HALL,WERE SOLD TO THE FOSTER FAMILY IN 1867.WILLIAM ORME FOSTER WAS AN IRON MASTER BUT WHO TOKK KEEN INTEREST IN AGRICULTURAL DEVELOPMENTS.HE BECAME A MODEL LANDLORD TO THE TENANTS ON THE ESTATE. THE ESTATE GREW TO 35OO HA., NEW TENANT FARMS WERE BUILT AND MOST OF THE BUILDINGS IN NORTON DATE FROM THIS EXPANSION IN THE 187OS. DURING THE SECOND WORLD WAR THE DEER PARK WAS PLOUGHED UP AND THE ESTATE BECAME A MODEL FOR THE WAR FOOD EFFORT, RECEIVING MANY DISTINGUISHED VISITORS. APLEY HALL WAS USED BY THE RED CROSS AS AN OFFICERS CONVALESCENT HOME. IN 1962 THE ESTATE CHANGED TO THE GOULBURN FAMLIY AND THEN IN 198O TO THE HAMILTON FAMILY.IN 1962 THE HALL BECAME A BOYS BOARDING SCHOOL.
